vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/91a9742b-2b19-4201-bd96-8b2f39e73738">WORKPLACE</keyword>         <topcClas>Population censuses - Population, vital statistics and censuses</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social indicators and quality of life - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>2001 Census: Special Licence Household Sample of Anonymised Records (SL-HSAR)</i> dataset comprises Sample of Anonymised Records (SARs) data that relate to 29 April 2001. They were created by the Office for National Statistics (ONS) as part of the <i>2001 Census of Population</i>. All households were asked to complete a form giving information about the household and all individuals living in the household. Completion of the form was compulsory for the entire population. The Census schedule includes questions on housing and tenure, and demographic and socio-economic information for all household members.<br>  <br> The dataset comprises SARs data for 1% of households in England and Wales, including imputed values for households which were not enumerated during the Census. Individual data for households larger than 11 residents have been suppressed. To protect confidentiality, age data have been grouped into 2-year bands and there is no geographical breakdown available. A small amount of perturbation has been applied to the data to protect confidentiality. As with the <i>Individual Licensed SAR</i> (see under SNs 7210 and 7211), separate variables indicate whether or not imputation or perturbation has been applied to any given variable for each case in the sample. Documentation, training and user support for these data is undertaken by the SARs team at the Cathie Marsh Centre for Census and Survey Research (CCSR). A further release of data, which contains additional derived variables, will be made available at a later date.<br> <br> <b>Special Licence Access</b><br> Since these data pose a higher risk of disclosure they have additional special conditions attached to them that take the form of a Special Licence (SL). Please see 'Access' section below for details.<br> <br> <b>Detailed SARs data</b>:<br> A more detailed version of these data, containing geographical information at the level of Local Authority, is available as a <i>Controlled Access Microdata Sample</i> (CAMS). These can be accessed at all ONS sites. Applications to use these data should be made to ONS; further details can be found on their <a href="http://www.statistics.gov.uk/census2001/sar_cams.asp" title="Controlled Access Microdata Sample">CAMS</a> web page. The CAMS file includes data for Scotland and Northern Ireland as well as England and Wales.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>A full range of census topics are included in the dataset, for example household structure, ethnicity and religion, housing, transport, employment, education and health and caring.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="single" date="2001-04-29T00:00:00Z">29 April 2001</timePrd>         <nation>England and Wales</nation>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit> Families/households</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Individuals in private households in England and Wales on 29 April 2001.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>Data were collected on 29 April 2001 as part of  the <i>2001 Census of Population</i>.</timeMeth>         <sampProc>One-stage stratified or systematic random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>525,715 individual records; 225,436 household records.</deviat>         <collMode>Self-completion</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No weighting used.</weight>         <cleanOps>A</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service Census support</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Special licence required</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about  usage.<br/>Additional special conditions of use also apply. See <a href='http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions.aspx'>terms and conditions</a>   for further information.<br/><br/> In addition, the UK Data Service  is required to request permission from the depositor prior to supplying the data.<br/>Available to UK applicants only.<br/><br/>Please note:<br/>Since these data pose a higher risk of disclosure than data made available under the standard End User Licence they have additional special conditions attached to them.  Any registered user requiring access to these data will have to be accredited by the UK Statistics Authority as an Approved Researcher.<br/><br/>To apply for accreditation a user will need to complete forms that will require: (i) evidence that he/she is a fit and proper person and details  about the purpose of the research; (ii) an online order for the data; (iii) a signed declaration that he/she understands the confidentiality obligations owed to those data including its physical security.<br/><br/>The evidence to be adduced will include previous research projects and publications. New users may need to provide the contact details of a senior  member of staff who can vouch for them. The research purpose form will ask for information about the intended use of the data, a justification for access and planned outputs.<br/><br/>Users who obtain access to these data are required to read and follow the <a href='http://www.data-archive.ac.uk/media/132701/UKDA171-SS-MicrodataHandling.pdf'>Microdata Handling and Security: Guide to Good Practice</a>.<br/><br/>To apply for access, users should use the Download/Order link on this page and will be directed to the relevant forms as part of the ordering process.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>6763 Modelling and Simulation for E-social Science: Individual, Household and Communal Establishment Populations, 2001 </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>Spencer N.J., Blackburn C.M. and Read, J.M. (2010) 'Prevalence of childhood disability and the characteristics and circumstances of disabled children in the UK: secondary analysis of the Family Resources Survey', <i>BMC Pediatr.</i>, 16(10), p.21.<br> <br></relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
